content.question: What am I looking for in a job?
content.answer: The ability work with a modern tech stack (ideally React based), where I can add maximise my value in a senior role. I would like to be involved when it comes technology strategy, team processes and coding standards. In addition, I find great enjoyment in helping others grow around me, through line-management or informal tutelage.

content.question: What are my best professional qualities?
content.answer: Leading a team from the front, delivering a high quality solution and an efficient problem solving mentality.

content.question: Am I open to contracting roles?
content.answer: Certainly, depending on location, remote working options and compensation. For duration of contract, ideally would not be under 6 months.

content.question: What job locations would be acceptable?
content.answer: Within commutable distance from SP11 - Newbury, Basingstoke, Southampton, Swindon, Reading, Bracknell, Oxford, London - see below

content.question: Am I open to London based roles?
content.answer: Yes, with caveats. I'm currently 2 hours each way from London, so commuting 5 days a week is a non-starter. Remote-working options would be a must, with easy transport links from Waterloo/Clapham Junction.

content.question: What level of Line Management experience do I have?
content.answer: I started whilst at IBM with a single developer. When working at CognitoIQ, I managed a team of 11. I was responsible for goal setting, 1-to-1's, appraisals and salary review. This has continued into my current role at MMT, where I manage a smaller group, many of whom are line managers themselves.

content.question: What experience do I have leading a team?
content.answer: I have lead teams on a day-to-day basis on my last two roles. This consists of defining team processes, engaging with stakeholders, delivering estimates, planning work and ensuring deadlines are met.

content.question: Am I willing to re-locate for a role?
content.answer: No. Aside from life changing compensation and you will need to convince my partner. Good luck.

coding.title: Software Development

testing.title: Quality Assurance
paragraphs: On recent projects, I have been brought in as a source of testing expertise. I have been driving for unit and integration testing of components to give confidence of their performance in production.
I have conducted a number of sessions on how testing should drive our work and not be an afterthought to placate business stakeholders.

I aim to construct robust tests from a consumer perspective and not to dissect implementation details. This reduces both false negatives and false positives, thus losing confidence in your testing strategy.

paragraphs: I always lead a team from the front, in order to balance meeting team deliverables whilst enabling growth of the individual. I enjoy being the point of contact with stakeholders, to ensure my team are able to maximise their productivity.

I have strong estimation and planning skills and the ability to balance priorities whilst working on multiple projects. I also have the ability to breakdown a large piece of work into discreet sections aiding delivery.
My experience includes managing a team, completing individual appraisals and running interview sessions.

techStack.title: Tech stack
paragraph: This site is built with React ‚öõÔ∏è and Gatsby üçæ, using styled components from Emotion üë©‚Äçüé§.
React is a Javascript library maintained by Facebook that is used for constructing user interfaces.
Gatsby is a React-based static site generator. This, alongside code splitting, intelligent image loading and asset optimisation leads to fast page loading times.
Emotion is a library designed for writing CSS in JavaScript. This removes the need for a global style-sheet and allows for co-location of style nearer to where it is used.
I have created an "atomic hierarchy" to aid abstraction and reuse throughout the application. In the future this component library may be published in a open-source NPM repository.
All code (apart from React/Gatsby/Emotion dependencies) is my own and has been written from scratch.

borneo.title: Raleigh International - Borneo
bulletPoints: I volunteered as a Project Manager on a 4 month expedition to Borneo. During my time away, I worked on two projects, in addition to exploring the Primary Rainforest with local army guides.

I helped with the construction of a research station in Danum Valley Rainforest. This involved many logical challenges, given the remote location and the fact that supplies could only be delivered by foot.

I was also involved in the construction of a primary school in the mountain top village of Linka Buagyan. As part of this project, I taught English classes with the local children. The sunrises were also spectacular as seen at the top of the page.
